lead_paragraph: Though a strong dollar and lower oil prices constrained August manufacturing, labor market strength could push the Fed closer to raising interest rates.

headline.print_headline: Activity Dips at Factories, but Signs Say Growth
headline.main: Factory Activity Dips, but Economic Growth Seems Promising

snippet: Though a strong dollar and lower oil prices constrained August manufacturing, labor market strength could push the Fed closer to raising interest rates....
abstract: Institute for Supply Management reports August factory activity contracted for first time in six months due to strong dollar and low oil prices softening demand for exports and heavy machinery; state unemployment figures released by Labor Dept signify robust labor market.
